keyMoments.title: Conis's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Conis meets the Straw Hat Pirates on Angel Beach while playing her harp. She warmly greets them and asks if they are from the Blue Sea, becoming their first friend in Skypiea.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Conis as a kind guide who will help the Straw Hats understand Skypiean culture and technology.
keyMoments.quote: Are you from the Blue Sea?

keyMoments.title: Helping Luffy with Conasshu Fruit
keyMoments.description: Conis kindly helps Luffy open a Conasshu fruit after he struggles with its steel-hard exterior, demonstrating her helpful nature and introducing the crew to Skypiean flora.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Conis's kindness and willingness to help strangers, establishing her as a trustworthy ally.

keyMoments.title: Teaching About Dials
keyMoments.description: Conis explains the concept and function of dials to the Straw Hats, demonstrating a Tone Dial and showing how integral this technology is to Skypiean daily life.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the crew (and audience) to one of Skypiea's most important technological and cultural elements.

keyMoments.title: Warning About Upper Yard
keyMoments.description: Conis solemnly warns the Straw Hats never to enter Upper Yard, the forbidden territory where God resides, speaking with genuine fear and concern for their safety.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the oppressive nature of God's rule in Skypiea and sets up the central conflict of the arc.
keyMoments.quote: You must never go to Upper Yard - The Land Where God Resides!

abilities.description: Conis is skilled at playing the harp, which she was doing when the Straw Hats first met her.

relationships.description: Pagaya is Conis's father. They live together on Angel Island and both show kindness to the Straw Hat Pirates.

evolutionMoments.description: Pagaya is introduced as Conis's father.

relationships.description: Su is Conis's pet cloud fox who accompanies her everywhere.

evolutionMoments.description: Su is introduced as Conis's beloved pet.

reveals.information: Native Skypiean living on Angel Island
Kind, helpful, and welcoming to strangers despite living under God's oppressive rule
Knowledgeable about dial technology and Skypiean culture

keyMoments.title: Su's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Su appears in Conis's arms as the Straw Hats meet her on Angel Beach. The adorable cloud fox immediately captures the crew's attention with its unique appearance.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Su as Conis's companion and showcases one of Skypiea's unique animal species.

relationships.description: Su is Conis's beloved pet cloud fox, always accompanying her.

evolutionMoments.description: Su is introduced as Conis's pet.

reveals.information: Cloud Fox - a unique species native to Skypiea

keyMoments.title: Pagaya's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Pagaya appears riding a waver across the cloud sea, crashing spectacularly upon arrival at Angel Beach. He is introduced as Conis's father and a skilled engineer.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Pagaya as an expert on dial technology and wavers, and shows even experienced Skypieans can struggle with difficult technology.

keyMoments.title: Explaining Dial Technology
keyMoments.description: Pagaya, as an engineer, explains how dials work and demonstrates various types to the Straw Hats, showing his expertise and knowledge.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Pagaya as a technical expert and provides crucial information about Skypiean technology.

keyMoments.title: Explaining Cloud Formation
keyMoments.description: Pagaya explains the scientific basis for Skypiea's existence, describing Sea Clouds and Island Clouds and how pyrobloin from seastone creates them.
keyMoments.significance: Provides scientific grounding for the sky islands and connects them to established One Piece lore (seastone).

keyMoments.title: Witnessing Nami Master the Waver
keyMoments.description: Pagaya is shocked when Nami immediately masters the waver, explaining that it typically takes ten years of practice to achieve such control.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights Nami's exceptional navigational abilities and sets up her future use of the waver.
keyMoments.quote: It takes ten years of practice to master the waver!

abilities.description: Pagaya is highly skilled in understanding and working with dial technology, particularly in waver construction and repair.
Pagaya can ride a waver, though he still occasionally crashes, showing the difficulty of mastering this vehicle.

relationships.description: Conis is Pagaya's daughter. He is protective of her and they work together to help the Straw Hats.

evolutionMoments.description: Pagaya is introduced as Conis's father.

reveals.information: Engineer specializing in waver repair and dial technology
Kind, humble, and willing to help strangers despite the risks under God's rule
Expert knowledge of dial technology and the scientific basis of Skypiea's clouds
